awd_titl_txt: Evaluating the Implementation of the South Carolina Beach-  front Management Act
awd_abstract_narration: Hurricane Hugo devastated beachfront communities from                           Charleston to Myrtle Beach destroying hundreds of shorefront                    structures.  Reconstruction has already begun under the 1988                    Beachfront Management Act and Hugo has provided an early test                   for some of the buildings which were located in this dead zone                  but were destroyed by the hurricane beyond repair will be                       tested.  The study will follow and analyze the decisionmaking                   process and the implementation of the retreat from the                          shoreline policy at the private and public, local, state and                    federal levels.  The evaluation of the effectiveness and                        viability of these rebuilding restrictions will be of benefit                   to researchers, administrators, insurers and other                              professionals interested in decreasing the vulnerability of                     people and property located in the coastal areas of the United                  States.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: RECTOR & VISITORS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
